column1: #Text=CBS News correspondent Mike Wallace dies at 93
#Text=Retired CBS News television correspondent Mike Wallace , known for his tough interviewing style , died April 7 , at Waveny Care Center in New Canaan , Connecticut , surrounded by his family .
#Text=" It is with tremendous sadness that we mark the passing of Mike Wallace .

#Text=He appeared in a 1998 documentary about depression called  Dead Blue . "

column1: #Text=Wallace attended the University of Michigan , where he delved into the broadcasting world .
#Text=He graduated in 1939 and became a communication officer in the U.S. Navy for three years during World War II .
#Text=In the 1940 ’s and 1950 ’s Wallace appeared on many television and radio shows doing both news and entertainment broadcasts .
#Text=He married a woman he meet at college , Norma Kaphan and they had two boys , Peter and Christopher .
#Text=Wallace then married actress Buff Cobb which ended in divorce .
#Text=He married twice more to Lorraine Perigord for 28 years and then Mary Yates , his current wife , turned widow .
#Text=He is survived by his two sons , wife , stepdaughter Pauline Dora and stepson Eames Yates including several grandchildren .
